lines.text:
[recognizing the man accompanying Coco Chanel]
Small demi-monde, *hein*?
I never made love to a woman in jodhpurs. I wonder what it's like.
Difficult.
You work too hard.
You work too never. Look, I won't be a moment. Saddle up some horses and we'll go for a ride.
Disgusting. Absolutely disgusting.

[about her father]
He's in America. He's a millionaire I believe. I haven't seen him for years. And that's about all.
I never knew my father. I was born on the wrong side of the blanket.
The wrong side of the blanket?
I'm a bastard.
I don't believe you. You are just saying that to make me feel better.
I picked the girl out of the gutter. I made a home for her. She was a nobody before she met me. I feel cheated by you.
Etienne. You don't own her. She doesn't belong to you. Coco and I did nothing to be ashamed of. We love each other very much.
Children. Now, children. Monsieur Poiret, in his day, designed some awfully pretty harem pants. The simple black dress, however, takes invention.
I came to tell you that I was wrong. I want you back.
You want me back? I never went anywhere.
How long has that been going on?

You have no right to ask. But I am going to tell you something. She is not the only one. I have lots of other lovers. I have everything now. Love. And success. My life is fulfilled and I don't need you anymore.
You call a succession of men and women love? Does it make you happy?
At least it doesn't make me unhappy.
